name: Income and Sales Tax
description:
This law is part of the federal tax code. The following taxes are included in this law: (1) Income Tax, (2) Alternate Income Tax, and (3) Sales Tax. Each tax sends a notification and additional information can be found via the commands "!tax" and "/tax card". You can mute each individual notification by using it's code in a command: !ITNOpt. You can use the master toggles: !OptInAll and !OptOutAll to toggle all notifications on or off.

Parliament expressly authorizes the Minister of Infrastructure to manage, modify, and remove districts governed by this law.

\\Implementation Notes: Following import, need to establish a government district for Article 4 and 10, and modify those sections.

properties.Title: Income Tax
properties.UserDescription:
Progressive income tax on individuals and companies**. The income used for evaluation is the average hourly income over the last 24-hour period. This means that your tax rate can and will change daily. However it is a progressive tax rate so only income past the threshold will be subject to a higher tax percentage. Your effective tax rate is a calculated value in this law. To aid in visibility of your effective tax rate, a notice will be sent to let you know what the tax rate is applied to each hour. You can also see your tax history by using /tax card. You may opt out of these notices by using the command !ITNopt.

There is a standard deduction of applied to the income tax to account for some expenses.

**Company legal people are considered "Citizens" AND excluded from the "Employee of Private Company" Demographic. The FedIncome statistic is recorded for ALL Company employees to the legal person. Therefore, this article of the law does NOT need to differentiate between citizen and companies as that work was already done when calculating the stat used in this article.

Transporters (zero-star citizens) are excluded from this tax and charged an alternate income tax that accounts for store expenses as the margin on transporting is really thin. The alternate tax is found in Article 6. 

Parliament Decisions:
Income Thresholds (hourly): 0, 50, 100, 200, 400, 800
Income Tax Percentages: 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20
Expense Deduction: 1,000

properties.Title: Income Tax Notification
properties.UserDescription: This article provides a toggle for the income tax notifications.

properties.Title: Flat Sales Tax
properties.UserDescription:
5% of transaction value to be taxed from the seller of every trade for goods, excluding when goods are purchased from government accounts regardless of location. If the seller is an employee of a company, the tax is actioned on the amount left untouched by the constitutional Company Income Scaling. If the initiating player is selling something but has only Self Improvement as a skill, then they are not taxed.

There are three cases:
1. the seller is neither an employee of a company nor a company himself. He pays the sales tax from his own pockets.
2. the seller is a company itself. The company pays the reduced sales tax rate from the company's bank account.
3. the seller is an employee of a company. The company pays the reduced sales tax rate from the company's bank account.

\\Implementation Notes: Add a new district (Government Stores) to tax exempt government stores.

properties.Title: Federal Income, Sales, and Expense Stats
properties.UserDescription:
This article records the income and expense stats for the federation when the Source Account is NOT a government account. If the Source Account is a government account, the "Receive Government Funds" event trigger is used instead. However, that trigger is currently bugged, so this stat is built manually through many articles and laws. In this article, specifically,: 

Move-in / Rent / Direct Transfers / Deed Sales (I/E)
Government Transfers (where gov account is target - i.e. tax) (E only, limited to federation laws)
Store Sales (I/E, SI/SE; non-gov to non-gov only)
Crafting payments / fees /refunds (I/E)
Repair Bounty (I/E, non-gov repair)

In other locations (if applicable):
PG specific stats (PG Law)
Contracts (Article 7)
Work Parties (Article 8)
Federal Wage Law (Article 9)
Gov Store Sales (Article 10)
Highway Payments (Highway Law)
Transporter Wage (Transporter Law)
Tree Stump Payments (Tree Law)
Loan Interest (Bank Law, exp only)
Bond Interest (Bank Law, Inc only)
Town-specific income/expense (exempt because not trackable)

\\Implementation Notes: The government transfers need to exclude the UBI/Loan Account, the federal bank main account (if banking law is used), share holding account / outstanding shares (if investment law is used)

properties.Title: Income Tax Alternate for zero-star
properties.UserDescription:
This article establishes the alternate income tax for zero-starred individuals. This modified income tax uses the Federal Income stat and offsets Federal Store Expenses due to transporters needing to buy and sell nearly all goods. The store expenses are credited against their income so that the tax is only charged on non-transporter related income plus their store reselling profit. NOTE: This article doesnt need to account for companies because the stats already do.

IMPORTANT NOTE: The income stats ignore the UBI account so UBI does not need to be accounted for in these tax brackets.
